definitions.text: (chemistry) a process in which one or more substances are changed into others
examples: there was a chemical reaction of the lime with the ground water

definitions.text: an idea evoked by some experience
examples: his reaction to the news was to start planning what to do

definitions.text: a bodily process occurring due to the effect of some antecedent stimulus or agent
examples: a bad reaction to the medicine
his responses have slowed with age

definitions.text: (mechanics) the equal and opposite force that is produced when any force is applied to a body
examples: every action has an equal and opposite reaction

definitions.text: a response that reveals a person's feelings or attitude
examples: he was pleased by the audience's reaction to his performance
John feared his mother's reaction when she saw the broken lamp

definitions.text: extreme conservatism in political or social matters
examples: the forces of reaction carried the election

definitions.text: doing something in opposition to another way of doing it that you don't like
examples: his style of painting was a reaction against cubism
